;According to the website of the National Information Security Standardization Technical Committee, the "Basic Security Requirements for Generative Artificial Intelligence Services" formulated by the organization Openly solicit opinions from the public. The document requires that data from corpus blacklist sources should not be used for training; if the content of a single source corpus contains more than 5% of illegal and harmful information, it should be included in the blacklist. A total of 31 major security risks in 5 categories of corpus and generated content are given in the appendix.

;

;For generative artificial intelligence, domestic regulation is almost in sync with technological development, reflecting the high importance attached to this technology. The "Interim Measures for the Management of Generative Artificial Intelligence Services" jointly issued by the Cyberspace Administration of China and multiple departments were released on July 10 and will come into effect on August 15. Article 17 of it stipulates: Provide services with public opinion attributes or social mobilization capabilities. For generative artificial intelligence services, security assessments should be carried out in accordance with relevant national regulations, and algorithm filing, change, and cancellation filing procedures should be performed in accordance with the "Regulations on the Management of Algorithm Recommendations for Internet Information Services".

;

;At present, many large models have been registered and can be officially launched online to provide services to the public, including Wen Xinyiyan (Baidu), Yunque (Douyin), Zidong Taichu (Chinese Academy of Sciences), etc. Articles 4 and 7 of the Measures respectively put forward certain requirements for the provision and use of generative artificial intelligence services and data training of models, involving multiple aspects such as values ​​and data sources. Obviously, the "Basic Requirements for Security of Generative Artificial Intelligence Services" that is currently soliciting opinions echoes and refines these regulations.

;

;What is special and unique about generative artificial intelligence? I think everyone’s ears are getting calloused after hearing this. At present, some generative artificial intelligence such as GPT-4 may have crossed the threshold of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). The translation of AGI as "general artificial intelligence" is actually somewhat misleading, because General Intelligence refers to "general intelligence." Let children test their IQ and take Raven's Matrices test questions that exclude the influence of specific language and culture. What comes out is this "general intelligence". AGI means that, through artificial methods, large models achieve "general intelligence" comparable to the human mind. A paper by Microsoft scientists shows that GPT-4’s intelligence is very close to human levels.

;

;This is a revolutionary breakthrough. Even if this type of large model approaches or reaches AGI, even if it is stable for a long time at a level equivalent to the average human intelligence level, its learning ability is beyond the reach of any human being: it can learn all the explicit knowledge created and accumulated by human beings, and any language can learn from it. It can master the knowledge of , pictures, audio and video presentation. This means that a large number of human knowledge jobs, such as translators and foreign language speaking teachers, can be replaced by this type of generative AI. The extent to which this will reshape our production and lifestyle is a question that everyone is concerned about and pondering.

;

;In addition, what values ​​generative artificial intelligence holds is an unavoidable question. We all have values. Why we have such values ​​depends not only on genes and other innate endowments, but also on acquired upbringing and habits. In the same way, without any intervention, the "values" of generative artificial intelligence depend on the corpus fed to it. The more corpus it is fed with a certain kind of value, the more it will exhibit that kind of value. If a certain value is artificially set for it in advance, then it will adhere to this value and reject negative interpretations of corpus that are inconsistent with its values.

;

;Judging from the early versions of GPT, this feature has already appeared. A classic example is: when it was asked to write a hymn to Biden, it readily agreed, and the writing was very crude; when it was asked to write a hymn to Trump, it flatly refused, stating that it wanted to be "politically neutral." Behind this is that the people who develop it hold these values. They can either set specific values ​​for it in advance, or feed it corpus impregnated with specific values, thereby shaping the values ​​of generative artificial intelligence.

;

;Of course, in public view, developers will try their best to hide the values ​​​​of generative artificial intelligence, and adopt a verbal strategy of "not offending anyone, not offending anyone", which sounds challenging. There is nothing wrong with this strategy itself being a reflection of certain values.

;

;If you think about it again, today's generative artificial intelligence is equivalent to having only a brain and no tangible body that can move freely, just like a soul floating in cyberspace. If this soul is "infused" into bionic robots or even intelligent robots whose mobility far exceeds that of human bodies in the future, the impact and potential harm to human society will be even greater. Can humans really control them effectively so that they only benefit and do not harm humans?

;

;Science fiction writer Asimov set the Three Laws of Robots: Robots must not harm humans, or sit idly by and watch humans being harmed; robots must obey human orders unless they violate the first law; robots must obey human orders unless they violate the first or second law. Law of Two, otherwise the robot must protect itself. This is probably just wishful thinking. In the future, intelligent robots equipped with AGI may be imported or "self-evolve" with anti-human values, putting the survival of civilization and mankind at risk; or some individuals or organizations with distorted values ​​​​will weaponize intelligent robots equipped with AGI and eliminate them. other nationalities or races or groups they dislike.

;

;Therefore, we are currently discussing: What can generative artificial intelligence do now and what can it do in the future? What values ​​should we hold? How big and what impact will it have on our production and lifestyle? Can humans harness it effectively? How much of a challenge will it pose to civilization and human existence itself? These questions are relevant and relevant to everyone on earth now and in the future. This is not unfounded worry, but preparation for a rainy day.

;

;"There is an emergency now, I'm sorry The original interview plan will be postponed again."

;

;On the evening of October 14, 2023, staff from the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (hereinafter referred to as "UNRWA") sent a message to Southern Weekend reporters News comes, postponing an interview with Communications Director Julia Tuma.

;

;Just the day before, the agency announced that "due to increased Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip" it had moved its operations center and staff to the southern Gaza Strip to continue supporting Palestinian refugees in the Gaza Strip.

;

;According to a statement issued by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) on October 17, the number of humanitarian workers killed in Gaza has increased to 31. Gaza has experienced a "total power outage" for the sixth consecutive day, the statement said. Gaza hospitals are on the verge of collapse, with fuel reserves used to run backup generators almost completely depleted, putting the lives of thousands of patients at risk.

;

;On the morning of the 15th, two days ago, IDF spokesman Jonathan Conricus posted a video on social media, once again issuing a warning to residents of northern Gaza, causing Palestinians in the area to flee to South. The Israeli military had previously issued a similar evacuation order to Gaza.

;

;This violent fight continues to expand in a cycle.

;

;Under Israel's counterattacks in recent days, today's Gaza neighborhoods have become beyond recognition, with ruins and ruins visible everywhere. In fear, many Gaza residents embarked on a journey to escape.   

;

;“We witness death every day.” local Said Shoaib wrote on social media.

;

;At present, Israel has implemented a comprehensive blockade on the Gaza Strip, including cutting off water supply, electricity and gas, closing all ports of entry, and bombing the Rafah port leading to Egypt, causing its infrastructure to not work properly.

;

;As the local humanitarian crisis rapidly deepens, many United Nations agencies have issued stern warnings. Philippe Lazzari, head of UNRWA, said Gaza was "rapidly turning into hell" and on the verge of collapse. He urged all parties to "put an end to this tragedy."

;

;On October 16, 2023, Xu Wei, spokesperson of the China International Development Cooperation Agency, said that China is providing emergency humanitarian assistance to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East and the Palestinian Authority respectively. To solve the urgent needs of food, medical care, housing and other needs in the Gaza Strip.

;

;As a new round of conflict between Palestine and Israel continues, the number of casualties on both sides is also rising. As of October 15, local time, the conflict had killed more than 4,100 people on both sides.

;

;Li Weijian, a researcher at the Foreign Policy Institute of the Shanghai Institutes for International Studies, told Southern Weekend reporters that Israel's "retaliatory actions" will continue for a period of time. "Hamas' actions are humiliating to Israel, so Israel needs to get a psychological balance." He believes that Israel will use this power to eliminate Hamas on a regular basis. "In fact, he is already doing this."

;

;;"Urban Street Fighting";

;

;"UNRWA" intern Wu Chenyu on October 12 She received an email stating that "11 staff members of the agency (Gaza office) were killed." Although she already knew the news, she still felt very sad.

;

;Wu Chenyu is an intern at the agency’s Jordan office. She told Southern Weekend reporters that the agency’s headquarters manages five field offices, namely Lebanon, Gaza, the West Bank, Syria and Jordan. The Jordanian relief office where she works has not been affected by the war yet, "but other field offices such as Gaza, staff have been informed to evacuate."

;

;Later on October 14, Hamas sent a message to Israel Rocket attacks were launched in Tel Aviv and surrounding areas, the central city of Bat Yam, the southern city of Ashkelon and other places. According to outside analysis, no one on either side of Palestine or Israel can predict exactly what will happen in the ground war. Hamas has proven that it can survive in previous Israeli-Palestinian conflicts and has "powerful weapons suitable for street fighting."

;

;The Qassan Brigades, an armed faction affiliated with Hamas, released information to the Israeli military on the 14th that the organization was "fully prepared" for "any ground military operations" by the Israeli army.

;

;The Gaza Strip covers an area of ​​approximately 360 square kilometers, with dense population and numerous houses.

;

;Previously, Hamas claimed to have built 500 kilometers of tunnels. Many experts and scholars believe that the tunnel network will make street fighting more difficult. Once the Israeli army and Hamas start "urban street fighting" there, both sides will suffer higher casualties than in the first few days of this round of Palestinian-Israeli conflict, and will have a negative impact on the Israeli army. pose a fatal threat.

;

;"There are two levels in the Gaza Strip, one for civilians and the other for Hamas." An IDF spokesman said on October 12 that these tunnels are just "bunkers for Hamas" ” so that they can continue to plot cross-border operations and fire rockets into Israel.

;

;Many media reports revealed that this "maze-like huge underground tunnel network" was built 30 meters underground in Gaza, with the entrance hidden on the ground floor of houses, schools and other public buildings. It is used for Hama Sri Lanka transports personnel, supplies, stores ammunition, etc., while avoiding Israeli artillery shells and reconnaissance.

;

;In the past few days, Israel has continued to launch air strikes on Gaza.

;

;But a week after the conflict broke out, Hamas was still able to fire rockets into Israel.

;

;The outside world believes that this is because the rockets hidden in the tunnels can be moved at any time. Saleh al-Arouri, one of the military leaders of Hamas, said before the outbreak of this round of Palestinian-Israeli conflict, "Hamas's defensive plan is more powerful than its offensive plan."

;

; "I don't think Israeli soldiers have the ability to attack these tunnels." Shaul, a Palestinian historian at Tel Aviv University's Middle East and African Studies Center, said, but Israel "will find a way to smoke out Hamas."

;

;Ma Xiaolin, director of the Mediterranean Research Institute at Zhejiang University of International Studies, believes that Israel cannot and will not completely eliminate Hamas. He said that Hamas has grown from small to large, and there is no lack of "contribution" to Israel for allowing it to grow to fight against the mainstream faction of the PLO. Retaining the Gaza Strip as the so-called "Hamastan" can continue to divide, weaken, and internally divide the Palestinian camp and benefit Israeli strategy.

;

;;Revenge and scruples;

;

;“I never imagined that this journey would be like this.”

;

;Have successfully returned from Israel Rao Pingman from China recalls her escape from Israel as if it was yesterday. After waiting for 15 hours at Tel Aviv Airport, Ms. Rao boarded a plane from Tel Aviv to Ethiopia on the morning of October 8, and then returned to China via the Ethiopia-Bangkok-Hong Kong route.

;

;At the same time, in retaliation for Hamas, the Israeli army has launched multiple rounds of air strikes in the Gaza Strip.

;

;The Israel Defense Forces publicly stated on the afternoon of October 16 that the head of Hamas’s intelligence agency was killed in an assassination operation by the Israeli army. Currently, Hamas has no response.

;

;The Israel Defense Forces also stated in a statement that the Israeli army has completed the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of reservists, and the logistics department is working hard to ensure the supply of weapons and equipment for ground troops. He also stated that the equipment needed for the battle has been moved to the assembly area.

;

;As a "counterattack" operation, Israel's actions can be called "all-round".

;

;On October 14, the Israel Defense Forces announced that it would implement a more extensive ground military action plan in the Gaza Strip and expand its offensive in the Gaza Strip, including launching "joint and coordinated attacks by air, sea and land." Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu previously threatened that the Israeli army would "destroy Hamas" through a ground offensive.

;

;The Israel Defense Forces stated that Israeli soldiers are preparing for "major ground operations" and that the Israeli army will implement an "extensive ground offensive plan" in the Gaza Strip to expand the offensive, including the implementation of "air, sea and joint coordinated attack on land.”

;

;Li Weijian believes that Israel's mentality at this time is not determined to fight a "win or lose" battle, but that Israel believes that the losses suffered this time are too great, so Hamas must pay the price and double the price. revenge. "Under this mentality, Israel will definitely do more in retaliation."

;

;From the night of October 12 to the early morning of October 13, the Israeli army attacked about 750 Hamas and other organizations in the Gaza Strip. Air strikes were carried out against targets. These include tunnels, military compounds, residences used as military command centers for senior members, weapons warehouses, communications rooms and 12 buildings housing Hamas assets.

;

;On the 11th, the day before that, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu gave a televised speech that night. He vowed to "crush and destroy" Hamas militants, saying that the Every member of the organization is a "dead person." The Israeli army also attacked two Hamas military bases in the Gaza Strip.

;

;In one of the compounds, the headquarters of the commander of Hamas's northern division was destroyed, and a military infrastructure building belonging to the Hamas naval unit was also attacked.

;

;The Israel Defense Forces stated that since the Palestinian-Israeli conflict broke out on October 7, the Israeli army has arrested more than 330 Palestinians in the West Bank, including more than 100 people related to Hamas. .

;

;However, many experts and scholars told Southern Weekend reporters that Israel's "counterattack" actions will not expand indefinitely.

;

;Ma Xiaolin judged that once the Gaza Strip, known as the "hornet's nest" and the "damned strip" by the Israelis, is included in the territory, Israel will once again bear a heavy burden of international law, morality, public opinion, economy, demographic structure and security. It will also put an end to the reconciliation process with Arab countries that has made significant progress.

;

;"Israel also has many concerns." Li Weijian analyzed that if Israel excessively causes a humanitarian crisis or kills many civilians, it will eventually arouse the anger of the Arab world.

;

;;"Hurt each other";

;

;After Israel's "evacuation order" was issued, residents of northern Gaza began to flee to the south, looking for shelter.

;

;In videos circulating on social media, residents of Wuyangyang stuffed their belongings into pickup trucks and cars. Some residents had to squeeze onto flatbed trucks pulled by livestock and move with difficulty.

;

;Some residents refused to leave and stayed in the collapsed and dilapidated houses. Speaking to the cameras, they said that while their homeland might be fraught with dangers, leaving would be "turning back the land and history."

;

;After a new round of conflict broke out, Said Shoaib's family had to go from the Brei refugee camp near the Israeli border to the Deir al-Balah refugee camp. He continues to document it on social media. He said, "There is no safe place in Gaza. Israel tells people to go to the south, but they are still bombing in the south."

;

;Under Israel's "blockade", World Health Organization spokesperson Jassa Revi Qi said Gaza's hospitals were running out of medical supplies and beds.

;

;The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs released news on October 13, stating that since the outbreak of the new round of Palestinian-Israeli conflict, the number of displaced people in the Gaza Strip has exceeded 420,000. United Nations agencies have called for funds to provide aid to Palestinians in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank.

;

;Meanwhile, the Israeli government released "horrific photos of babies being killed and burned by Hamas monsters." The three photos were posted on the social media accounts of Netanyahu's office. But Hamas denies the accusations.

;

;Yang Ran, who has now fled to Turkey, moved into the shelter of his school in Israel with his luggage when a new round of conflicts broke out. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the place has complete water, electricity and internet connections and is safer than other shelters.

;

;"The battlefield is mainly concentrated in the south. In the central part where I am, except for a few thousand rockets on the first day, the number of rockets decreased thereafter, and even buses and trains were restored the next day." Yang Ran revealed , because Israelis may have one or two rocket attacks every year, they are "relatively accustomed to it."

;

;“The size of the economic damage to Israel will depend on how long these reservists are away from work.” Eyal Winter, an economics professor at Israel’s Hebrew University, said.

;

;Since the outbreak of the conflict, the Israel Defense Forces has called up many reservists to perform tasks. These reservists come from all walks of life. They are separated from daily economic production activities and go into battle.

;

;; The quagmire of ";;Multi-front operations";

;

;Currently, Israel has fully "blocked" Hamas-controlled areas In the Gaza Strip, water and electricity supplies were cut off. The move has the United Nations concerned about an exacerbation of the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres urged all parties to allow the United Nations to provide humanitarian assistance to the Gaza Strip.

;

;As a United States that is "busy on both sides", it has made frequent "big moves" since the Palestinian-Israeli conflict escalated.

;

;The U.S. White House announced on October 16 that after visiting Israel on October 18, U.S. President Biden will go to the Jordanian capital Amman to meet with Jordanian King Abdullah II and Egyptian President Sisi. Met with Palestinian President and Palestinian National Liberation Movement (Fatah) Chairman Mahmoud Abbas to discuss conflict-related matters.

;

;On October 14, US Secretary of Defense Austin ordered the "Eisenhower" aircraft carrier strike group to head to the Eastern Mediterranean. He said this was "part of efforts to contain the expansion of the war." Biden publicly stated that the White House is quickly "providing additional security assistance such as ammunition and missile interception systems" to Israel. He urged the U.S. Congress to take urgent action to approve funds to meet the security needs of the United States' "key partners" including Israel.

;

;“The United States sends an aircraft carrier fleet to support Israel and deter Iran and Hezbollah, but it will not actively intervene in the Gaza war and create enemies on all sides in the Middle East, and it does not want to get stuck in the quagmire of the Middle East again.” Zhejiang International Studies University’s Mediterranean Research Ma Xiaolin, the dean of the hospital, said.

;

;In this conflict, Iran, which was speculated to be a "supporter" of Hamas, held its first meeting with senior Hamas officials.

;

;On the evening of the 14th local time, Iranian Foreign Minister Abdullahiyan met with Hamas leader Haniyeh in Doha, the capital of Qatar. He called on Israel not to launch a ground attack on the Gaza Strip. He also warned that if the Lebanese Hezbollah joins the conflict, this round of conflicts may further expand to other regions in the Middle East, which will cause Israel to suffer huge losses.

;

;When will this cycle of violent fighting stop?

;

;Marzouk, a member of the Hamas Political Bureau, said on October 10 that Hamas "has achieved its goals" and is open to discussing "similar things" and "all political dialogue" about a ceasefire. The Qatar Al Jazeera website reported that Hamas has captured a sufficient number of Israeli soldiers, but Hamas will only be willing to discuss the issue of prisoner exchange after the war is over.

;

;It is noteworthy that conflicts also broke out in the border areas between Israel and Lebanon.

;

;The Lebanese National News Agency reported that on October 15, local time, Israel launched an artillery bombardment on the southern Lebanese border town of Al-Dhahira, causing complete disruption of public road traffic. It is generally believed that if the situation on the Lebanese-Israeli border escalates further, Israel may face a "second front" in the north.

;

;Ma Xiaolin said that the main battlefield of this conflict has been moved to the Gaza Strip. No matter how large the casualties are, the war will not spill over to the four countries of Palestine, Israel, Lebanon, and Syria. "Coupled with the first phone call between the heads of state of Saudi Arabia and Iran to discuss the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, this shows that the regional identity politics game once led by both parties will not be repeated, and the Palestinian issue may continue to be marginalized."

;

;"Next, Israel will still take future development into consideration." Li Weijian analyzed that Israel has to deal with Middle Eastern countries and Arab countries, and it also hopes to maintain the situation it has finally opened and improve the development of relations with other countries.

;

;Mao Ning, spokesperson of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, called on the top priority to cool down the situation, cease fire and violence, protect civilians, and avoid humanitarian disasters. When dealing with international and regional hot-spot issues, major countries should adhere to objectivity and fairness, maintain calmness and restraint.

;

;(At the request of the interviewees, Rao Pingman and Yang Ran are pseudonyms)

;

;Consumer prices rose moderately, the employment situation was generally stable, and residents' income grew steadily. The per capita disposable income of residents across the country was 29,398 yuan, a nominal increase of 6.3% year-on-year; after deducting price factors, the real growth was 5.9%, 0.1 percentage point faster than the first half of the year.

;"Overall, the national economy has continued to recover in the first three quarters, and high-quality development has been solidly advanced, laying a solid foundation for achieving the full-year development goals. ;Not long ago, the "only daughter in Jiangsu, Zhejiang and Shanghai" became popular on the Internet, becoming the most enviable female character template after "Single Aunt" and "Runaway Wanyu". In the imagination of netizens, an only daughter born in a well-off middle-class family in the Yangtze River Delta enjoys the resources and love of her family. ;On October 17, the official website of the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security announced that the State Council appoints and removes national staff. Among them, Sun Guangyu was appointed as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council; Wang Zhiqing was removed from the post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council.

;

;Sun Guangyu previously served as a member of the Party Committee and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management. Wang Zhiqing, who has resigned, has served as Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group.  

;

;Since July this year, the deputy secretary-general of the State Council has been reshuffled frequently, with "four in and four out" - Sun Guangyu, Xu Shouben, Wang Zhijun, and Wang Yonghong have assumed the new posts, while Wang Zhiqing, Ding Xuedong, Peng Shujie, and Li Wenwen have resigned.

;

;In March this year, during the two sessions of the National People’s Congress, the leadership team of the central government changed, and State Councilor Wu Zhenglong also served as Secretary-General of the State Council. According to public reports, there are currently at least 7 deputy secretaries-general of the State Council, namely Meng Yang, Liu Jianbo, Guo Wei, Wang Zhijun, Wang Yonghong, Xu Shouben, and Sun Guangyu (in order of appointment). Among them, Wang Zhijun is clearly at the ministerial level.

;

;;The four new deputy secretaries-general of the State Council come from different fields;

;

;The four new deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who took up their posts this year come from different fields. He is an expert in the field. Sun Guangyu has worked in the chemical industry for a long time and is an expert in the field of hazardous chemical safety supervision. Before taking up his new post, he served as a member of the Party Committee and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management; Xu Shouben is a "veteran" in the financial industry and before taking up his new post, he served as the vice president of the China Development Bank. ; Wang Zhijun has been engaged in economic management work in central ministries and commissions for a long time, and served as deputy secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Party Committee before taking office; Wang Yonghong has long worked in the State Administration Bureau (referred to as the State Administration Bureau), serving for 32 years, and took office in June this year. Secretary of the Party Leadership Group and Director of the Management Bureau.

;

;The four new people are all born after 1965, among whom Wang Yonghong and Xu Shouben were both born in 1969.

;

;;;

;Sun Guangyu. Data map

;

;Sun Guangyu, who took office as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council today, was born in December 1966. He has a university degree, a master's degree in engineering, a professor-level senior engineer, and a member of the chemical industry group of the National Safety Production Expert Group.

;

;Sun Guangyu graduated from Dalian University of Technology, majoring in fine chemical engineering. According to the official website of Dalian University of Technology, he worked at Sinopec in his early years. In 2009, he was transferred from the manager of the Aromatics Department of the Tianjin Branch of Sinopec Co., Ltd. to the deputy director and director of the Safety Supervision and Management Department III of the State Administration of Work Safety, and later served as the Hazardous Chemicals Department of the Emergency Management Department. Director of the Supervision Department and Director of the First Department of Hazardous Chemical Supervision. In June 2022, Sun Guangyu served as a member of the Party Committee and Vice Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, and later served as deputy director of the Office of the State Council Safety Committee.

;

;More than a week ago, Sun Guangyu interviewed the main person in charge of the Ordos Municipal People's Government on behalf of the Security Affairs Office of the State Council.

;

;According to the Ministry of Emergency Management, on September 7, a major high-pressure gas leak occurred at Yiding Ecological Agriculture Development Co., Ltd. in Ordos, Inner Mongolia, resulting in 10 deaths and 3 injuries in a major production safety accident. On September 14, the State Council Safety Committee decided to supervise the investigation and handling of this major accident. On September 11, the Ministry of Emergency Management organized a national emergency video conference on hazardous chemicals safety risk prevention, at which the situation of the Ordos "9.7" accident was reported. Sun Guangyu, member of the Party Committee and Vice Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, attended the meeting and delivered a speech. The meeting pointed out that lessons from the accident must be carefully learned, and the lessons learned in blood must not be verified with blood again!

;

;On October 8, in response to the "9.7" major high-pressure gas leakage accident in Ordos, the Office of the State Council Safety Committee interviewed the main person in charge of the Ordos Municipal People's Government. Sun Guangyu, deputy director of the Office of the State Council Security Committee and deputy minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, presided over the interview, and heads of relevant departments and bureaus of the Ministry of Emergency Management attended the interview.

;

;Now, Sun Guangyu has left the chemical industry and emergency management leadership position he held for many years and joined the State Council.

;

;;;

;Xu Shouben. Data map

;

;Xu Shouben took office as deputy secretary-general of the State Council on August 30.

;

;Public information shows that Xu Shouben was born in April 1969 in Yantai, Shandong Province. He graduated from the School of Management of Harbin Institute of Technology and received a doctorate in Western Economics from Lingnan College of Sun Yat-sen University and is a senior economist.

;

;Xu Shouben has worked in the financial industry for many years. He joined the Guangdong Branch of ICBC in April 1995. He has worked in various branches of ICBC in Guangdong Province for a long time. He once served as the Office Director of ICBC Guangdong Branch, President of Guangdong Jiangmen Branch, and Party committee secretary and other positions. In March 2011, he was appointed as the vice president of the Guangdong Branch and in July 2015, he was appointed as the president of the Shenzhen Branch. In August 2020, Xu Shouben was promoted to Vice President of ICBC. In October 2022, Xu Shouben was appointed as Vice President of the China Development Bank and will take office as the State Council in August this year.

;

;;;

;Wang Zhijun. Data map

;

;Wang Zhijun and Wang Yonghong took up their posts on the same day and were appointed deputy secretary-general of the State Council on July 4. Among them, Wang Zhijun is in charge of the daily work of the General Office of the State Council and is clearly at the ministerial level. He is a member of the 20th Central Committee.

;

;The public resume shows that Wang Zhijun was born in September 1965 in Hohhot, Inner Mongolia, and has a graduate degree.

;

;Wang Zhijun has been responsible for economic management for many years. He has served as the director of the National Economic Comprehensive Department of the National Development and Reform Commission, deputy inspector of the Comprehensive Group of the Office of the National Energy Leading Group, and deputy director of the Economic Bureau No. 1 of the Office of the Central Financial and Economic Leading Group. , inspector, director of the fifth economic bureau, director of the first economic bureau of the Office of the Central Financial and Economic Commission, etc. In January 2019, Wang Zhijun was appointed as a member of the Party Leadership Group and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. In April 2022, he was transferred to the position of Deputy Secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Party Committee, and he will assume the new position of the State Council in July this year.

;

;;;

;Wang Yonghong. Data map

;

;Wang Yonghong has worked in the State Administration of Institutional Affairs for a long time. The National Administration Bureau is an agency directly under the State Council that manages the affairs of state agencies. It is responsible for the management of funds, finances, official vehicles, state-owned assets and real estate of central state agencies, and is responsible for the management of life services for party and state leaders and relevant service objects within a designated range. .

;

;According to the official website of the State Administration of Management, Wang Yonghong, born in June 1969, has a bachelor's degree and a master's degree in management. He joined the National Bureau of Management in August 1991 and served successively as deputy director of the Financial Management Department, deputy director of the Logistics Reform and Comprehensive Management Department, director of the training center, director of the Financial Management Department, and director of the Dongba Service Center of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs; 2017 In April 2017, he was appointed as deputy director, member of the Party Leadership Group and director of the Dongba Service Center of the State Administration of Management. In November 2017, he was appointed as deputy director and member of the leading party group of the State Administration of Management.

;

;On June 20 this year, relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee attended the meeting of leading cadres of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs and announced the central government’s decision: Comrade Wang Yonghong was appointed as Party Secretary and Director of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs.

;

;Wang Yonghong has assumed the new post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council and concurrently serves as Party Secretary and Director of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs. Previous directors of the State Administration of Management were also concurrently held by the deputy secretary-general of the State Council.

;

;;Of the four deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who have resigned, three have assumed new duties;

;

;Of the four deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who have resigned this year, three have assumed their new posts. new.

;

;Wang Zhiqing, who resigned as deputy secretary-general of the State Council today, has been appointed chairman and party secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. a week ago. Among the three deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who resigned on July 4, Ding Xuedong has served as Party Secretary of the National Council for Social Security Fund, and Li Wenwen has served as Deputy Minister of the Central Ministry of Social Work and Director of the Office of the Central Joint Conference on Petitions, and continues to serve concurrently as the National Petitions Committee. Director of the Bureau and Secretary of the Party Leadership Group.

;

;;;

;Wang Zhiqing. Data map

;

;The public resume shows that Wang Zhiqing was born in March 1966 and is from Tianjin. Wang Zhiqing has worked in the civil aviation system for a long time. He joined the Civil Aviation Administration of China in 1992 and held leadership positions in multiple departments. In March 2014, he was appointed deputy director of the Civil Aviation Administration of China. In March 2019, he was transferred to the position of member of the Party Leadership Group, Chief Planner, and Director of the Comprehensive Planning Department of the Ministry of Transport. In February 2021, he was promoted to Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Transport. In November 2021, Wang Zhiqing was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council.

;

;According to the "China Eastern Airlines" WeChat public account, on the morning of October 9, China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. held a meeting for middle-level and above managers. Relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China announced the decision of the Central Committee on the appointment of Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd.: Comrade Wang Zhiqing is appointed as Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. China Eastern Airlines, headquartered in Shanghai, is one of China's three major state-owned backbone air transport groups.

;On July 4, the State Council appointed and removed national staff. ;;;

;Ding Xuedong. Data map

;

;Ding Xuedong was a member of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. He served twice as deputy secretary-general of the State Council and served as executive deputy secretary-general of the State Council before resigning.

;According to the public resume, Ding Xuedong, born in February 1960 in Changzhou, Jiangsu Province, is a master's student in the Industrial Economics Department of Hubei Institute of Finance and Economics (now Zhongnan University of Economics and Law), and a finance major in the Graduate Department of the Institute of Fiscal Science of the Ministry of Finance. PhD in Economics, doctoral supervisor at the Institute of Fiscal Science of the Ministry of Finance.

He joined Xinhua News Agency in 1989 and served successively as reporter and deputy director of Xinhua News Agency’s external central news gathering and editing office, deputy director and director of the external central foreign affairs news gathering and editing office, chief editorial assistant (deputy bureau level) of Xinhua News Agency’s chief editorial office, Xinhua News Agency He serves as deputy editor-in-chief of the editorial office and director of the International Department of Xinhua News Agency. In July 2014, he was promoted to deputy editor-in-chief and party member of Xinhua News Agency. In November 2015, he was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council and retired after serving for nearly 8 years.

;;;

;Li Wenwen. Data map

;

;According to public resume, Li Wenwen was born in January 1963. He graduated from the Department of Political Science and Law of Ningxia University and received a postgraduate degree from the Central Party School.

;

;He worked in Ningxia for a long time in his early years and served as deputy secretary of the Yinchuan Municipal Party Committee (department level), director of the Department of Justice and Party Secretary of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region; secretary of the Shizuishan Municipal Party Committee and Guyuan Municipal Party Committee secretary of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. In December 2018, he served as director of the Political Department of the Ministry of National Security, member of the Party Committee, secretary of the party committee of the agency, and deputy chief superintendent.

In terms of institutional reform of the Party Central Committee, five new "Chinese-prefixed" institutions including the Central Department of Social Work were established. Among them, the Central Ministry of Social Work is responsible for coordinating and guiding the people's petition work, guiding the collection of people's suggestions, coordinating and promoting party building to lead grassroots governance and grassroots political power building, unified leadership of the party work of national industry associations and chambers of commerce, and coordinating and promoting the deepening reform and transformation of industry associations and chambers of commerce. Development, guiding the party building work of mixed-ownership enterprises, non-public enterprises, new economic organizations, new social organizations, and new employment groups, and guiding the construction of social work talent teams, etc., as a functional department of the Party Central Committee.

;The "Plan" also clarifies that the Central Ministry of Social Work will unifiedly lead the National Bureau of Letters and Calls. ;;What are the responsibilities of the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council? ;

;How many people are generally allocated to the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council? According to the Chinese Government website, the State Council issued a "Regulations on the Main Responsibilities, Internal Organizations and Staffing of the General Office of the State Council" in July 2008, which mentioned that the administrative establishment of the General Office of the State Council is 519. Among them: 1 Secretary-General of the State Council, 9 Deputy Secretary-Generals of the State Council (including part-time ones), and 43 department-level leadership positions.

;

;What are the responsibilities of the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council?

;

;The "Working Rules of the State Council" revised in March this year clearly mentioned that the State Council implements the prime minister's responsibility system. For matters that have disagreements between departments, the leading comrades of the State Council in charge of the sponsoring department shall take the lead in strengthening coordination. The Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council shall assist The leading comrades in charge of the State Council shall do a good job in coordination.”
